channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Individual consultations for Juniors to Discuss Fellowship Funding
item.description: Fellowships provide a salary and tuition while you earn a graduate degree. Personal consultations to recommend programs and other resources for your professional objectives are now available. Spring and fall 2025 graduates are encouraged to book a virtual meeting. For information, contact madige@rpi.edu or Schedule here
item.author: Students

item.title: Medline Info Session to be held March 11 at 5:30 PM
item.description: Calling all Biomedical Engineering & Mechanical Engineering students: Medline invites you to their virtual event at 5:30 PM, Explore Co-Op Opportunities at Medline Industries! If you are curious about what a co-op at Medline could look like, the CCPD invites you to hear directly from Medline employees about their day-to-day work, fun projects, and what they enjoy most about Medline! More information in Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: West Point on the March
item.description: Tuesday, March 11, 2025 7:00 PM - Join the West Point Band for “West Point on the March,” an exploration of the most classic American military musical genre: the march, featuring some of Sousa’s best-known works alongside lively selections like “Americans We” and Ethel Smyth’s anthem of women’s suffrage, “March of the Women.” For full description, visit https://webforms.rpi.edu/west-point-march. Free and open to the public.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium: Professor Kai Liu, Georgetown University
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Title: “Nanomaterials and Spintronics for a Sustainable Future” Please see link for the full abstract.
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Colloquium: Felix Ye, University at Albany
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Robust Differentiation for Regularized Optimal Transport” by Dr. Felix Ye, Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at SUNY Albany.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI’s Quantum System One Maintenance scheduled for March 4th
item.description: IBM will be performing maintenance on RPI’s Quantum System One on Tuesday, March 4, 2025 between the hours of 8am–12pm. Any in-progress jobs will finish before the queue is paused. Once IBM is finished, processing of queued jobs will continue.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quick Learn Webinar: Considering Brave Spaces vs. Safe Spaces in Discussions
item.description:
Date: Thursday, March 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this workshop we will look at the strategies around building brave spaces versus safe spaces and what that means in situations when in a learning environment with a group of peers discussing challenging topics. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this workshop. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
